intro: Crinitina, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their distinctive, often branched inflorescences that resemble small umbels, giving them a unique appearance. Crinitina species are typically found in coastal areas and can thrive in sandy or saline soils. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by feathery bracts. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking foliage and floral structures.
